hints.content:
The number line shows $\maroonD{10}$ equal jumps of $\blueD{7}$ units.

![The same number line with each arrow labeled, plus 7](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/16ed2f453c9b1802bceb3051c3b35fe9184ad659)

options.explanation:
We can reach the same total using $\blueD{7}$ equal jumps of $\maroonD{10}$ units.

![A number line labeled 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 60, 70. Arrows labeled, plus 10, point right from each number to the next.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/fb9ad369504380ae26b6cee3438e01df4f7f2cdd)

$\blueD{7} \times \maroonD{10} = \underbrace{\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}+\maroonD{10}}_{\blueD{7}\maroonD{\text{ tens}}}=\greenD{70}$

So $\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{7}=\greenD{70}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**  
*Hint: Use the number line below to help solve the equation.* 

$10 \times 7 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]
